sen.j: 大中臣輔親（おおなかとみ の すけちか、天暦8年（954年） - 長暦2年6月2日 (旧暦)（1038年7月6日））は、平安時代中期の歌人。
sen.e: ONAKATOMI no Sukechika, 954 - July 6, 1038, was a poet in the mid-Heian period.
ONAKATOMI no Sukechika, 954 - July 6, 1038, was a poet in the mid-Heian period.
ONAKATOMI no Sukechika (954 - July 6, 1038) was a poet in the mid-Heian period.
His father was ONAKATOMI no Yoshinobu.
His father was ONAKATOMI no Yoshinobu.
His father was ONAKATOMI no Yoshinobu.
His mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Kiyokane.
His mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Kiyokane.
His mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Kiyokane.

sen.j: 娘に女流歌人伊勢大輔がいる。
sen.e: A lady poet, ISE no Taifu was his daughter.
A lady poet, ISE no Taifu was his daughter.
A lady poet, ISE no Taifu was his daughter.

sen.j: 中古三十六歌仙の一人。
sen.e: He was one of the Medieval Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.
He was one of the Medieval Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.
He was regarded as one of the medieval 36 Immortal Poets.

sen.j: 寛和2年（986年）文章生となり、その後正三位神祇伯に至り、祭主となる。
sen.e: In 986 he became a Monjosho (student of literature and history) and later took office of Director of the Jingikan (Council of Shinto rituals), further promoted to the Saishu (Officer) of Ise.
In 986 he became a Monjosho (student of literature and history) and later took office as Director of the Jingikan (Council of Shinto rituals), and further promoted to the Saishu (Officer) of Ise.
In 986 he became a Monjosho (student of literature and history) and later took office as Director of the Jingikan (Council of Shinto rituals), and further promoted to the Saishu (Officer) of Ise.

sen.j: 大中臣氏重代の歌人で、三条天皇・後一条天皇・後朱雀天皇の大嘗祭（だいじょうえ）和歌を詠進。
sen.e: He was a poet of the family of Onakatomi who produced excellent poets for generations. He submitted his verses on the occasion of Daijoe (the Ceremony of Imperial Accession) for Emperors Sanjo, Goichijo, and Gosuzaku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was a poet of the family of Onakatomi who produced excellent poets for generations. He submitted his verses on the occasion of Daijoe (the Ceremony of Imperial Accession) for Emperors Sanjo, Goichijo, and Gosuzaku.

He was a poet of the family of Onakatomi who produced excellent poets for generations and submitted his verses on the occasion of Daijoe (the Ceremony of Imperial Accession) for Emperors Sanjo, Goichijo, and Gosuzaku.

sen.j: また屏風歌の制作や歌合でも活躍した。
sen.e: He also composed byobu-uta (verses on themes depicted on folding screen) and was an active participant of poetic contests.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He also composed byobu-uta (verses on themes depicted on folding screen) and was an active participant of poetry contests.
He also composed byobu-uta (verses on themes depicted on folding screen) and was an active participant of poetry contests.

sen.j: 妻の蔵命婦は藤原道長の三男・藤原教通の乳母である。
sen.e: His wife, KURA no Myobu, served as the wet nurse of FUJIWARA no Yorimichi, the third son of FUJIWARA no Michinaga.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His wife, KURA no Myobu, served as a nurse to FUJIWARA no Yorimichi, the third son of FUJIWARA no Michinaga.
His wife, KURA no Myobu, served as a wet nurse to FUJIWARA no Yorimichi, the third son of FUJIWARA no Michinaga.

sen.j: 輔親も同様に乳母父として仕えた。
sen.e: He also served Yorimichi as nurse father.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He also served Yorimichi as a nurse.
He also served Yorimichi as a nurse.

sen.j: その縁で、娘の伊勢大輔が藤原彰子に仕えることになったと思われる。
sen.e: This connection perhaps helped his daughter ISE no Taifu to wait on FUJIWARA no Shoshi (Akiko).
This connection perhaps helped his daughter ISE no Taifu get a position serving FUJIWARA no Shoshi (Akiko).
This connection perhaps helped his daughter ISE no Taifu get a position serving FUJIWARA no Shoshi (also known as Akiko).

sen.j: (蔵命婦が伊勢大輔の母親であるかどうかは不明である)
sen.e: (It is unclear, however, whether KURA no Myobu was ISE no Taifu's mother.)
(It is unclear, however, whether KURA no Myobu was ISE no Taifu's mother.)
(It is unclear, however, whether KURA no Myobu was ISE no Taifu's mother.)

sen.j: 「拾遺和歌集」以下の勅撰和歌集に入集。
sen.e: His verses were selected in the imperial anthologies from 'Shui Wakashu' (The Collection of Gleanings) onwards.
His verses were selected for the imperial anthologies from 'Shui Wakashu' (The Collection of Gleanings) onwards.
His verses were selected for the imperial anthologies from 'Shui Wakashu' (The Collection of Gleanings) onwards.

sen.j: 家集に「輔親卿集」がある。
sen.e: He also compiled the private anthology 'Sukechikakyo-shu' (the Selected Verses of Lord Sukechika).
He also compiled the private anthology 'Sukechikakyo-shu' (the Selected Verses of Lord Sukechika).
He also compiled the private anthology 'Sukechikakyo-shu' (the Selected Verses of Lord Sukechika).
